long_desc.thetext:
Fedora 41 Fail To Build From Source Tracker

Reproducible: Always

Reproducible: Always

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 40 development cycle.
Changing version to 40.

Fedora 41 Fails To install Tracker

Reproducible: Always

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 40 development cycle.
Changing version to 40.

seamonkey failed to build from source in Fedora rawhide/f41

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=120779532


For details on the mass rebuild see:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_41_Mass_Rebuild
Please fix seamonkey at your earliest convenience and set the bug's status to
ASSIGNED when you start fixing it. If the bug remains in NEW state for 8 weeks,
seamonkey will be orphaned. Before branching of Fedora 42,
seamonkey will be retired, if it still fails to build.

For more details on the FTBFS policy, please visit:
https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fesco/Fails_to_build_from_source_Fails_to_install/

Created attachment 2042721
build.log

file build.log too big, will only attach last 32768 bytes

root.log

file root.log too big, will only attach last 32768 bytes
Planned to be fixed in the upcoming upstream version 2.53.19 (some weeks).
*** Bug 2298248 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 2301849 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116 (seamonkey-2.53.19-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116

FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116 has been pushed to the Fedora 41 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

Hello,

Please note that this comment was generated automatically by https://pagure.io/releng/blob/main/f/scripts/ftbfs-fti/follow-policy.py
If you feel that this output has mistakes, please open an issue at https://pagure.io/releng/

All subpackages of a package against which this bug was filled are now installable or removed from Fedora 42.

Thanks for taking care of it!
I have been using the rawhide seamonkey today and it seems fine.

FEDORA-2024-90f1d7e116 (seamonkey-2.53.19-1.fc41) has been pushed to the Fedora 41 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
